page.title: 09A BIRD SURVEY OF EAGLE
page.content: Some time ago the upper juniors did a bird survey covering the catchment area of Eagle school.They spotted 73 different species.Experienced ornithologists would have found a lot more. The children counted 10 species which were summer visitors.There were 3 different kinds of warblers.They were blackcap,sedge warblers and willow warbler.There were 4 kinds of waders .They were common sandpiper, green sandpiper, snipe and redshank. There were 4 kinds of owls.They were the barn owl, tawny owl, long-eared owl and little owl. Kestrels are still quite common. Sparrowhawks are sometimes seen during migration times and during winter. Buzzards have been seen at North Scarle in the winter and early spring.
